CityCampSF Hackathon Set for December 10-11

By Kevin Curry

November 17, 2011

CityCampSF, Gov 2.0 Radio, OpenSF, Third Thursdays SF and Granicus are hosting 24 hours of civic innovation.

Challenges include:

Best demonstration app for assessing the impacts of clear-cutting in the Sierra Nevadas;

Best app combining City data sources for transparency in SF campaign donations, lobbying and contracting;

Best use of Granicus APIs;

Submit a challenge and ask questions on the CityCampSF Hackathon Projects page.

The event will also launch an advocacy campaign for structured open data definitions in San Francisco municipal and California state law. Endorse that effort here.

Contribute funds to cover the cost of the event here, at Nation Builder.

WHEN

December 10, 2011 at 12:00 PM – December 11, 2011 at 12:00 PM

WHERE

Granicus
600 Harrison St
Suite 120
San Francisco, CA 94107
Google map and directions

CONTACT

Adriel Hampton · adriel@adrielhampton.com · 415-237-4299

Kevin Curry is the co-founder of CityCamp.
